description: This course examines limitations in psychosocial functioning of individuals and families that are due to psychiatric disorders. Content focuses on the biobehavioral basis of psychiatric disorders, as well as the psychosocial, developmental, and physiological needs of individuals and their families. Care of individuals having acute episodes and chronic problems are discussed.
name: PSYCH MENTAL HEALTH NURSING: THEORY

values.comments: Students found lectures to be informative, however, found Professor Vergano to be distant and unreceptive to student feedback and questions later in the course. They appreciated her use of guest lecturers to diversify material, but overall found the aims of the course to be misguided and disorganized.
